title: Piers Morgan cuts his son out of his WILL over JK Rowling fight
text:
Piers Morgan cuts his son out of his WILL over JK Rowling fight The GMB host isn't taking this Twitter beef too well Share Get   Thank you for subscribing!   
Piers Morgan may not be presenting Good Morning Britain at the moment, but he's still doing everything he can to get himself noticed. 
And following the awkward Twitter storm he had with J K Rowling (which culminated in him insisting he'd never read a word of Harry Potter, despite writing a column about it some years previously), his own son decided to side with the author. 
Uploading a picture of the Deathly Hallows symbol he's got tattooed on his bicep, Spencer Morgan shared it with both his dad and Rowling, captioning the snap: "Well this is awkward." 
Sure enough, Piers took the bait and tweeted to say Spencer could no longer look forward to enjoying the fruits of his dad's labour as he was no longer in Piers' will. 
"My son will be sorrier, I just cut him out of my will. cc @spencermorgan93 ," he posted. 
There's been no response yet from Spencer, though he has been sharing pictures of himself holding a Gryffindor scarf while standing outside a model of Hogwarts, and of himself waiting to go into the Cursed Child play. 
Since their initial fight last week, Piers and JK have been trading barbs over Twitter â€“ but most of their followers firmly agree that JK has come out on top. 
On Tuesday, JK trolled Piers hard by tweeting a screenshot of an article paying tribute to her writing and her impact on children's literacy, asking the author of the piece to step forward so she could thank him. 
And he immediately jumped on her tweet, calling it a "priceless humblebrag BS" and adding: "Nobody plays the celebrity game more abusively or ruthlessly than you, Ms 'Intensely Private Billionaire'." 
The only problem? Piers had written the gushing piece. 
"THIS IS A VALENTINES MIRACLE," posted one follower. 
"I bet he's having a monumental trumpesque meltdown," said another tickled tweeter. 
"Don't forget to refill the banter decanter before you go to bed tonight," wrote a third. Read More
